remarks: Properties that determine a division ring. ` I ` (reciprocal) is normally dependent on ` x ` i.e. read it as ` I ( x ) ` ." (Contributed by NM, 2-Aug-2013.)
statement:
isdrngd.b $e |- ( ph -> B = ( Base ` R ) ) $.
isdrngd.t $e |- ( ph -> .x. = ( .r ` R ) ) $.
isdrngd.z $e |- ( ph -> .0. = ( 0g ` R ) ) $.
isdrngd.u $e |- ( ph -> .1. = ( 1r ` R ) ) $.
isdrngd.r $e |- ( ph -> R e. Ring ) $.
isdrngd.n $e |- ( ( ph /\ ( x e. B /\ x =/= .0. ) /\ ( y e. B /\ y =/= .0. ) ) -> ( x .x. y ) =/= .0. ) $.
isdrngd.o $e |- ( ph -> .1. =/= .0. ) $.
isdrngd.i $e |- ( ( ph /\ ( x e. B /\ x =/= .0. ) ) -> I e. B ) $.
isdrngd.j $e |- ( ( ph /\ ( x e. B /\ x =/= .0. ) ) -> I =/= .0. ) $.
isdrngd.k $e |- ( ( ph /\ ( x e. B /\ x =/= .0. ) ) -> ( I .x. x ) = .1. ) $.
isdrngd $p |- ( ph -> R e. DivRing ) $.
$d .0. x y $.
$d .1. x y $.
$d .x. x y $.
$d B x y $.
$d I y $.
$d R x y $.
$d ph x y $.
